Interface_name: HTTP Server - side by using http.server in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a simple HTTP server in Python that can handle GET, HEAD, and POST requests, with customizable port configuration.

Class Description: SimpleHTTPServer is a class that implements a basic HTTP server capable of processing GET, HEAD, and POST requests. It includes an inner RequestHandler class that manages the actual request processing and response generation.

Attributes:
- port: int - The port number on which the server will listen (default: 8080)
- server_address: tuple - A tuple containing the server address and port (default: ('', port))
- handler_class: class - The request handler class that processes HTTP requests

Methods:
- __init__(port: int = 8080) -> None - Initializes the server with the specified port
- run() -> None - Starts the HTTP server and begins serving requests indefinitely
- RequestHandler._set_headers() -> None - Sets basic HTTP response headers (200 status and text/html content type)
- RequestHandler.do_GET() -> None - Handles HTTP GET requests
- RequestHandler.do_HEAD() -> None - Handles HTTP HEAD requests
- RequestHandler.do_POST() -> None - Handles HTTP POST requests, reading and printing the posted data
